definition: to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: Selling goods on credit cause uncollectible accounts expense to customers who fail to pay their bills.
sentences.chinese: 坏账损失是由于赊销给无力支付账款的客户而形成的。

sentences.english: Every business, however, would rather sell for cash than on account.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，每家企业都宁愿现销而非赊销。

sentences.english: Credit conditions mainly refers to enterprise customers will be asked to pay the conditions of the credit payment.
sentences.chinese: 信用条件主要指企业要求客户支付赊销账款的条件。

sentences.english: They have a remarkable fascination in people and what makes them tick .
sentences.chinese: 他们在人中拥有一种非凡的魔力能使他们赊销。

sentences.english: They sold grain on credit during time of famine.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿季节他们则赊销粮食。

definition: to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy on credit/to delay payment
to defer payment/to pay back over long term
